CrossReferencesList.description: A reference to another word that is closely related, might provide additional information about the subject, has a variant spelling or is an abbreviated form of it.

type.description: The type of relation between the two words. Possible values are 'close match', 'related', 'see also', 'variant spelling', and 'abbreviation' in case of crossreferences, or 'pre', 'post' in case of collocates.

CrossReferencesList.title: CrossReferencesList

etymologies.description: The origin of the word and the way in which its meaning has changed throughout history

homographNumber.description: Identifies the homograph grouping. The last two digits identify different entries of the same homograph. The first one/two digits identify the homograph number.

variantForms.description: Various words that are used interchangeably depending on the context, e.g 'a' and 'an'

definitions.description: A list of statements of the exact meaning of a word

registers.description: A level of language usage, typically with respect to formality. e.g. 'offensive', 'informal'

senseIds.description: The list of sense identifiers related to the example. Provided in the sentences endpoint only.

results.description: A mapping of filters available per endpoints.

inflections.description: A list of filters available for LEMMATRON endpoint

translations.description: A list of filters available for Translations endpoint

wordlist.description: A list of filters available for Translations endpoint

phoneticNotation.description: The alphabetic system used to display the phonetic spelling

phoneticSpelling.description: Phonetic spelling is the representation of vocal sounds which express pronunciations of words. It is a system of spelling in which each letter represents invariably the same spoken sound

regions.description: A particular area in which the pronunciation occurs, e.g. 'Great Britain'

actions.title: domains.source_domains_language.target_domains_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [domains](documentation/glossary?term=domain) for a given bilingual language dataset.

actions.title: domains.source_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [domains](documentation/glossary?term=domain) for a given monolingual language dataset.

actions.title: entries.source_language.word_id.sentences.get
actions.description: Use this to retrieve sentences extracted from corpora which show how a word is used in the language. This is available for English and Spanish. For English, the sentences are linked to the correct sense of the word in the dictionary. In Spanish, they are linked at the headword level.

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.get
actions.description: Use this to retrieve definitions, pronunciations, example sentences, grammatical information and word origins. It only works for dictionary headwords, so you may need to use the Lemmatron first if your input is likely to be an inflected form (e.g., 'swimming'). This would return the linked headword (e.g., 'swim') which you can then use in the Entries endpoint. Unless specified using a region filter, the default lookup will be the Oxford Dictionary of English (GB).

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.antonyms.get
actions.description: Retrieve words that are opposite in meaning to the input word (antonym).

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.regions_region.get
actions.description: USe this filter to restrict the lookup to either our Oxford Dictionary of English (GB) or New Oxford American Dictionary (US).

region.description: Region filter parameter. gb = Oxford Dictionary of English. us = New Oxford American Dictionary.

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.synonyms.get
actions.description: Use this to retrieve words that are similar in meaning to the input word (synonym).

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.synonyms_antonyms.get
actions.description: Retrieve available [synonyms](documentation/glossary?term=thesaurus) and [antonyms](documentation/glossary?term=thesaurus) for a given word and language.

actions.title: entries.source_lang.word_id.filters.get
actions.description: Use filters to limit the entry information that is returned. For example, you may only require definitions and not everything else, or just pronunciations. The full list of filters can be retrieved from the filters Utility endpoint. You can also specify values within the filter using '='. For example 'grammaticalFeatures=singular'. Filters can also be combined using a semicolon.

filters.description: Separate filtering conditions using a semicolon. Conditions take values grammaticalFeatures and/or lexicalCategory and are case-sensitive. To list multiple values in single condition divide them with comma.

actions.title: entries.source_translation_language.word_id.translations_target_translation_language.get
actions.description: Use this to return translations for a given word. In the event that a word in the dataset does not have a direct translation, the response will be a [definition](documentation/glossary?term=entry) in the target language.

actions.title: filters.get
actions.description: Returns a list of all the valid filters to construct API calls.

actions.title: filters.endpoint.get
actions.description: Returns a list of all the valid filters for a given endpoint to construct API calls.

actions.title: grammaticalFeatures.source_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [grammatical features](documentation/glossary?term=grammaticalfeatures) for a given language dataset.

source_language.description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

actions.title: inflections.source_lang.word_id.get
actions.description: Use this to check if a word exists in the dictionary, or what 'root' form it links to (e.g., swimming > swim). The response tells you the possible [lemmas](documentation/glossary?term=lemma) for a given [inflected](documentation/glossary?term=inflection) word. This can then be combined with other endpoints to retrieve more information.

actions.title: inflections.source_lang.word_id.filters.get
actions.description: Retrieve available [lemmas](documentation/glossary?term=lemma) for a given [inflected](documentation/glossary?term=inflection) wordform. Filter results by categories.

filters.description: Separate filtering conditions using a semicolon. Conditions take values grammaticalFeatures and/or lexicalCategory and are case-sensitive. To list multiple values in single condition divide them with comma.

actions.title: languages.get
actions.description: Returns a list of monolingual and bilingual language datasets available in the API

sourceLanguage.description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

targetLanguage.description: IANA language code. If provided output will be filtered by sourceLanguage.

actions.title: lexicalcategories.language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of available [lexical categories](documentation/glossary?term=lexicalcategory) for a given language dataset.

actions.title: regions.source_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [regions](documentation/glossary?term=regions) for a given monolingual language dataset.

actions.title: registers.source_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [registers](documentation/glossary?term=registers) for a given monolingual language dataset.

actions.title: registers.source_register_language.target_register_language.get
actions.description: Returns a list of the available [registers](documentation/glossary?term=registers) for a given bilingual language dataset.

actions.title: search.source_lang.get
actions.description: Use this to retrieve possible headword matches for a given string of text. The results are culculated using headword matching, fuzzy matching, and lemmatization

prefix.description: Set prefix to true if you'd like to get results only starting with search string.

regions.description: If searching in English, filter words with specific region(s) either 'us' or 'gb'.

limit.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

offset.description: Offset the start number of the result.

actions.title: search.source_search_language.translations_target_search_language.get
actions.description: Use this to find matches in our translation dictionaries.

prefix.description: Set prefix to true if you'd like to get results only starting with search string.

regions.description: Filter words with specific region(s) E.g., regions=us. For now gb, us are available for en language.

limit.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

offset.description: Offset the start number of the result.

actions.title: wordlist.source_lang.filters_advanced.get
actions.description: Use this to apply more complex filters to the list of words. For example, you may only want to filter out words for which all senses match the filter, or only its 'prime sense'. You can also filter by word length or match by substring (prefix).

filters_advanced.description: Semicolon separated list of wordlist parameters, presented as value pairs: LexicalCategory, domains, regions, registers. Parameters can take comma separated list of values. E.g., lexicalCategory=noun,adjective;domains=sport. Number of values limited to 5.

exclude.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes headwords that have any senses in specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results.

exclude_senses.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes only those senses of a particular headword that match specified exclusion attributes (lexical categories, domains, etc.) from results but includes the headword if it has other permitted senses.

exclude_prime_senses.description: Semicolon separated list of parameters-value pairs (same as filters). Excludes a headword only if the primary sense matches the specified exclusion attributes (registers, domains only).

word_length.description: Parameter to speficy the minimum (>), exact or maximum (<) length of the words required. E.g., >5 - more than 5 chars; <4 - less than 4 chars; >5<10 - from 5 to 10 chars; 3 - exactly 3 chars.

prefix.description: Filter words that start with prefix parameter

exact.description: If exact=true wordlist returns a list of entries that exactly matches the search string. Otherwise wordlist lists entries that start with prefix string.

limit.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

offset.description: Offset the start number of the result.

actions.title: wordlist.source_lang.filters_basic.get
actions.description: Use this to retrieve a list of words for particular [domain](documentation/glossary?term=domain), [lexical category](documentation/glossary?term=lexicalcategory), [register](documentation/glossary?term=registers) and/or [region](documentation/glossary?term=regions). View the full list of possible filters using the filters Utility endpoint. The response only includes headwords, not all their possible inflections. If you require a full wordlist including inflected forms, contact us and we can help.

filters_basic.description: Semicolon separated list of wordlist parameters, presented as value pairs: LexicalCategory, domains, regions, registers. Parameters can take comma separated list of values. E.g., lexicalCategory=noun,adjective;domains=sport. Number of values limited to 5.

limit.description: Limit the number of results per response. Default and maximum limit is 5000.

offset.description: Offset the start number of the result
